filmography.title: The Royal Family of Broadway
filmography.role_description: A flamboyant, self-absorbed actor modeled after John Barrymore, whose return home throws his theatrical family into chaos.
filmography.plot: A parody of the Barrymore family, centering on a acting dynasty who struggles to balance their personal lives with their public personas.

filmography.title: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
filmography.role_description: A kind scientist who unleashes his inner beast through a chemical experiment, transforming into a sadistic monster in this defining pre-Code horror role.
filmography.plot: Dr. Jekyll allows his dark side to run wild when he drinks a potion that turns him into the evil Mr. Hyde.

filmography.title: Merrily We Go to Hell
filmography.role_description: An alcoholic reporter and playwright whose marriage to an heiress crumbles under the weight of his addiction and infidelity.
filmography.plot: A Chicago newspaperman marries an heiress, but his drinking and an old flame threaten to destroy their marriage.

filmography.title: Smilin' Through
filmography.role_description: A dual role playing two generations of men involved in a tragic romance and a bitter family feud spanning decades.
filmography.plot: A woman falls in love with the son of the man who accidentally killed her guardian's fiancée years earlier.

filmography.title: The Sign of the Cross
filmography.role_description: A Roman prefect who falls in love with a Christian woman, testing his loyalty to Emperor Nero during the persecution of Christians.
filmography.plot: A Roman soldier falls in love with a Christian woman during the reign of Nero, leading to a crisis of faith and loyalty.

filmography.title: Design for Living
filmography.role_description: A playwright who enters into a 'gentleman's agreement' with his painter friend to share a muse without sex, a plan that quickly unravels.
filmography.plot: A playwright, a painter, and a commercial artist enter into a platonic ménage à trois in Paris.

filmography.title: Death Takes a Holiday
filmography.role_description: Death himself, who takes human form as a prince for three days to understand why humans fear him, only to fall in love.
filmography.plot: Death decides to take a holiday from his usual business to see what it is like to be a mortal.

filmography.title: The Barretts of Wimpole Street
filmography.role_description: The vibrant poet who sweeps the invalid Elizabeth Barrett off her feet and rescues her from her tyrannical father.
filmography.plot: The invalid poetess Elizabeth Barrett defies her domineering father to marry the dashing poet Robert Browning.

filmography.title: Les Misérables
filmography.role_description: A former convict who struggles to redeem his life and protect his adopted daughter while being hunted by a relentless policeman.
filmography.plot: In 19th-century France, a paroled convict seeks redemption while being pursued by a ruthless police inspector.

filmography.title: Anna Karenina
filmography.role_description: The dashing military officer whose passionate affair with a married aristocrat leads to her social ruin and tragedy.
filmography.plot: A married aristocrat enters a passionate but destructive affair with a military officer, leading to social ostracization.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Win – Best Foreign Film

filmography.title: The Dark Angel
filmography.role_description: A WWI soldier who is blinded in battle and hides his survival from his fiancée to spare her the burden of caring for him.
filmography.plot: A woman believes her fiancé was killed in the war, unaware that he is alive but blind and hiding from her.

filmography.title: Anthony Adverse
filmography.role_description: An illegitimate son raised by a merchant who embarks on a sprawling journey across continents to find his place in the world.
filmography.plot: In 18th-century Italy, a young man embarks on a journey of self-discovery that takes him across the world.

filmography.title: A Star Is Born
filmography.role_description: A fading, alcoholic matinee idol who discovers a young talent and marries her, only to tragically self-destruct as her star rises.
filmography.plot: A movie star helps a young singer and actress find fame, even as age and alcoholism send his own career into a downward spiral.

filmography.title: Nothing Sacred
filmography.role_description: A disgraced reporter who exploits a young woman's alleged radium poisoning for a human interest story, falling for her in the process.
filmography.plot: A reporter tries to redeem his reputation by covering the story of a woman supposedly dying of radium poisoning, unaware she is healthy.

filmography.title: The Buccaneer
filmography.role_description: The charismatic pirate who assists General Andrew Jackson in the Battle of New Orleans during the War of 1812.
filmography.plot: Pirate Jean Lafitte falls in love with a Governor's daughter and helps the Americans fight the British in the War of 1812.

filmography.title: Susan and God
filmography.role_description: The alcoholic husband of a flighty socialite who tries to save his marriage when his wife returns from Europe obsessed with a new religious movement.
filmography.plot: A socialite tries to convert her friends and family to a new religious movement, alienating her husband and daughter.

filmography.title: So Ends Our Night
filmography.role_description: A German refugee fleeing the Nazis across Europe who risks his life to return to see his dying wife.
filmography.plot: Three refugees roam Europe without passports, trying to stay one step ahead of the Nazis.

filmography.title: I Married a Witch
filmography.role_description: An aspiring politician who becomes the target of a witch's revenge curse but ends up marrying her instead.
filmography.plot: A witch burned at the stake centuries ago returns to haunt the descendant of the Puritan who condemned her.

filmography.title: The Adventures of Mark Twain
filmography.role_description: The iconic American author, portrayed from his early days as a riverboat pilot through his literary success and personal tragedies.
filmography.plot: A biographical look at the life of humorist and author Samuel Clemens, better known as Mark Twain.

filmography.title: The Best Years of Our Lives
filmography.role_description: A World War II sergeant who returns home to his job as a banker, struggling to reconcile his wartime experiences with civilian life.
filmography.plot: Three WWII veterans return home to small-town America to discover that they and their families have changed.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Oscar: Win – Best Picture

filmography.title: Another Part of the Forest
filmography.role_description: The tyrannical, self-made patriarch of the Hubbard family in this prequel to 'The Little Foxes', dealing with his treacherous children.
filmography.plot: The ruthless Hubbard family engages in betrayal and deceit in the post-Civil War South.

filmography.title: Death of a Salesman
filmography.role_description: An aging, delusional traveling salesman who struggles to face the reality of his failed career and strained family relationships.
filmography.plot: An aging salesman faces the end of his career and the failure of his dreams, leading to a tragic conclusion.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: Executive Suite
filmography.role_description: A calculating, profit-driven financial executive vying for the presidency of a furniture company after the CEO's sudden death.
filmography.plot: When a powerful CEO dies suddenly, a boardroom power struggle erupts to determine his successor.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Win – Special Jury Prize

filmography.title: The Bridges at Toko-Ri
filmography.role_description: A compassionate naval commander who cares deeply for his pilots but must send them on a dangerous mission in the Korean War.
filmography.plot: A Navy pilot redeploys to fight in the Korean War and must bomb a set of highly defended bridges.

filmography.title: The Desperate Hours
filmography.role_description: A suburban father who must use his wits to protect his family when they are held hostage in their home by escaped convicts.
filmography.plot: Three escaped convicts take a suburban family hostage while waiting for their getaway money to arrive.

filmography.title: The Man in the Gray Flannel Suit
filmography.role_description: A broadcasting tycoon who tries to mentor a younger executive while regretting the personal costs of his own ambition.
filmography.plot: An ex-soldier faces ethical questions as he tries to earn enough to support his wife and children.

filmography.title: Middle of the Night
filmography.role_description: A lonely, widowed garment manufacturer who falls in love with his much younger receptionist, facing disapproval from his family.
filmography.plot: A 56-year-old widower falls for his 24-year-old receptionist/secretary, causing turmoil in both their families.

filmography.title: Inherit the Wind
filmography.role_description: A fundamentalist politician and orator based on William Jennings Bryan, who prosecutes a teacher for teaching evolution.
filmography.plot: Based on the real-life Scopes 'Monkey' Trial, two great lawyers argue the case for and against a science teacher accused of teaching evolution.
filmography.awards: Berlin Int'l Film Festival: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Seven Days in May
filmography.role_description: A beleaguered U.S. President who faces a military coup d'état after signing a controversial nuclear disarmament treaty.
filmography.plot: United States military leaders plot to overthrow the President because he supports a nuclear disarmament treaty and they fear a Soviet sneak attack.

filmography.title: Hombre
filmography.role_description: A corrupt Indian agent who embezzles government funds and becomes a liability to his fellow stagecoach passengers.
filmography.plot: John Russell, disdained by his 'respectable' fellow stagecoach passengers because he was raised by Indians, becomes their only hope for survival.

filmography.title: The Iceman Cometh
filmography.role_description: The owner of a saloon for down-and-out drunks who is forced to confront his own pipe dreams; March's final film role.
filmography.plot: A traveling salesman visits a run-down saloon and tries to convince the patrons to give up their pipe dreams.
